When a Muslim pass away, the amount/property/estate is inheritable after:
1. Paying for the expenses of the funeral 
2. Returning of debts 
3. Giving away the will (which cannot be more than 1/3 of the amount/property/estate) 
 Note: Will can't be written after the legal heirs which are already receiving shares in inheritance. After the paying above, the remaining property will be eligible for inheritance as per below-mentioned shares: 
 A. Husband: 
 1. The husband gets 1/2 if no child/children is/are present 
 2. The husband gets 1/4 if child/children is/are present 
 B. Widow: 
 1. The widow gets 1/4 if no child/children is/are present 
 2. The widow gets 1/8 if child/children is/are present 
 3. If more than one wife/widow, all the widows share equally out of the 1/4 or 1/8 share. 
 C. Father (of the deceased): 
 1. Father without child/children is treated as Residuary i.e. after giving shares to the Quranic heirs will get the residue. 
 2. If the child/children of the deceased exist then the father will get 1/6. 
 D. Mother (of the deceased): 
 1. The share of mother is 1/3 in the ABSENCE of child/children or two brothers or two sisters or 1 brother and 1 sister. 
 2. The share of mother is 1/6 in the PRESENCE of child/children or two brothers or two sisters or 1 brother and 1 sister. 
 3. If the mother is with father and the widow/wife (or husband) is also present, the mother will get 1/3 of what remains after deducting the share of spouse (wife/wives or husband). 
 E. Daughter: 
 1. The share of single i.e. one daughter is 1/2. 
 2. If the daughters are more than one i.e. two or more, the share is 2/3 to be divided 
 3. If the son is also present with the daughter. The daughter will inherit as Residuary. Two parts will go to the son and one part to the daughter. 
 F. Full Sister (Sister from Same Mother and Same Father) 
 1. A full sister will not get the share in inheritance in the presence of: 
 a. Child/Children, or 
 b. Child/Children of son, or 
 c. Father, or 
 d. Father's father. 
 2. If the sister is one, she will get 1/2. 
 3. If the sister is more than one i.e. two or more full sisters, they will get 2/3. 
 4. If the bother exists along with sister, she inherits as Residuary (with two shares going to the brother(s) and one share to the sister). 
 G. Residuaries: 
When the deceased has no Sharers present, the property will be inherited by the Residuaries. Secondly, after distribution of the property, a residue remains and the residuary exists, the residue will go to the Residuaries. It some cases the Sharers will become the Residuaries e.g, a daughter with son, sister together with brother. The father without children (of the propositus) will become the Residuary. 
The list of Residuaries is as below: 
 1. Son: 
 a. when the daughter does exist the son takes the entire residue. 
 b. when son and daughter both exist, the son gets double the share of a daughter. 
 2. Father: 
 The whole residue will go to the father. 
 3. Full Brother: 
 a. If the sister does not exist, the full brother inherits the entire residue. 
 b. If the sister exists along with the brother, the full brother inherits with her but his share is double the share of a sister. 
 4. Full Sister: In the absence of above-mentioned residuaries, the full sister is treated as Residuary.
